docs.title: Welcome!
docs.text:
This site documents two companion tools:

Tool Purpose Millwork PlanSwift Plugin Package Enriches PlanSwift with millwork–specific lists, item types, layouts and reports Assembly Builder Application Generates bulk millwork assemblies—with live inventory costs—ready for PlanSwift importing

Important:

Be advised this documentation assumes that users are familiar with PlanSwift functionality. Please see the Official PlanSwift Documentation for more information. Todd Kaberline's PlanSwift Developers Course is also a great learning resource.

docs.title: New users
docs.text: Start with Getting Started → Installation.

docs.title: Existing users
docs.text: Head over to How-to for various step-by-step instructions or browse the Reference section for item field definitions.

docs.title: Release at a glance
docs.text:
• Plugin: 2.0.0 (includes first batch of 80 assemblies)
  • Assembly Builder: 1.3.2 (Python 3.11 executable)

docs.title: 2.0.0 · 2025-05-16
docs.text:
• Initial public release of Millwork Plugin.
  • Includes 4 list tables, 3 layouts, 3 reports.
  • Bundled 880 assemblies generated 2025-05-15.

docs.title: 1.3.2 · Assembly Builder
docs.text:
• Added --skip-unchanged CLI flag.
  • Fixed ODBC error on systems without Access Runtime.

docs.title: FAQ
docs.text:
Q : Do I need to rerun Assembly Builder for every job? A : Only when inventory prices change; assemblies are global.

Q : Can I add my own custom lists? Yes—add a new .mdb in PlanSwift Data\Lists and register via Options ▸ Data Paths.

Q : Where is the log file? %LOCALAPPDATA%\MillworkAssemblyBuilder\builder.log.

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Symptom Likely cause Fix Assembly Builder “ODBC driver not found” 32-bit Access Driver missing Install AccessDatabaseEngine_X64.exe PlanSwift script hangs at 60 % Item with duplicate GUID Delete dup, rerun script Report totals $0 [Takeoff] quantity missing Re-measure or set static Qty

docs.title: Architecture Overview
docs.text:
flowchart TD
  A[Inventory Excel Worksheet With Data From PDWiz] --> B["Separate Tables For Millwork Inventory, Manufacture Labor, Install Labor & External Items"];
  B --> F[Assembly Builder References Excel Tables For SKU #s];
  F --> G["Export Assemblies As PlanSwift Scripts (.psscript files)"];
  G --> H["Use #quot;Create Tools#quot; Millwork Plugin To Create Assemblies Via PlanSwift Scripts (.psscript files)"];

  B --> C[Import Each Excel Table's Data Into Microsoft Access Database Tables]
  C --> D[Import Microsoft Access Database Tables Into PlanSwift Lists];
  D --> E[Select From Dropdown List Properties When Creating Items];

  E --> I;
  H --> I[Use Proper Assembly Structure To Create Items & Complete Takeoffs];
  I --> J[Use Job Margin Values, Takeoff Measurements & Item Cost Data To Generate A Variety Of PlanSwift Reports];
  J --> K[Use PlanSwift Reports To Create Quotes]

docs.title: Data Flow
docs.text:
1. Inventory update → Excel sheet.
  2. Assembly Builder reads → recalculates assembly JSON.
  3. Pascal script inserts/updates items in PlanSwift DB.
  4. Reports query [Takeoff] quantities + costs.

Info

Costs live only in PlanSwift after step 3; reports stay accurate even if sheet changes later.

docs.title: Versioning & Release Workflow
docs.text:
Artifact Versioning rule Example Plugin (.pszip) SemVer, bump minor on inventory change, major on schema change 2.1.0 Assembly Builder SemVer, bump patch for bugfix 1.3.2 Inventory sheet Date-stamped filename inventory_2025-05-16.xlsx

Process:

  1. Update inventory → commit sheet.
  2. Run CI to generate new assemblies & plugin build.
  3. Tag Git release.
  4. Publish on portal; update Changelog.

docs.title: Installation & First-time Setup
docs.text:
Important

Users should be using the BFS version of PlanSwift 10.2 Both tools have been tested on Windows only

docs.title: 1. Download installers
docs.text: File Link Millwork PlanSwift Plugin 2.0.0.zip (internal portal) Millwork Assembly builder 1.0.0.zip (internal portal)

docs.title: 2. Import the Plugin
docs.text:
1. Extract contents from the downloaded zip file.
  2. Open PlanSwift → Plugins ▸ Import Plugin Package.
  3. Select Millwork Plugin Package 2.0.0
  4. Restart PlanSwift when prompted – you should now see Millwork plugins in Estimating ribbon.

docs.title: 3. Install Assembly Builder
docs.text: 1. Simply extract the executable file from the downloaded zip file.

docs.title: 4. Verify
docs.text:
• C:\Program Files (x86)\PlanSwift10\Data\Plugins\Create Tools contains several PSSCRIPT type files.
  • C:\Program Files (x86)\PlanSwift10\Data\Plugins\Millwork Databases contains the Millwork Microsoft Excel Worksheet and Microsoft Access Database files.

Next: Quick-start ▸ Plugin.

docs.title: Quick-start · Assembly Builder
docs.text: Goal: regenerate assemblies when inventory costs change and import them in bulk.

docs.title: 1 Launch & connect database
docs.text:
1. Start Assembly Builder.
  2. Settings ▸ Inventory source → point to \\shared\inventory_costs.xlsx (or local).

docs.title: 2 Generate scripts
docs.text:
• Click Build Batch ▸ choose STD HOUSE PACKAGE.
  • App outputs export\MillworkAssemblies_2025-05-16.psscript.

docs.title: 3 Import into PlanSwift
docs.text:
1. PlanSwift ► Tools ▸ Execute Script → select the .psscript.
  2. Check Takeoff panel: existing items update, new ones appear.

Info

Assembly Builder skips identical rows (hash match) for speed.

docs.title: 4 Verify pricing
docs.text:
Run Segment Cost report; totals should match updated inventory.

Next: learn Generate bulk tools.

docs.title: Quick-start · Plugin Package
docs.text: Goal: Complete a millwork takeoff that pulls inventory costs from the included list databases to generate an accurate quote.

docs.title: Step 1: Create A New Job
Step 2: Complete Your Takeoff
Step 3: Adjust Margins & Generate Reports
Use-case
docs.text:
You need an Assembly that is not included in the prebuilt Millwork Template.

DemoFlowchart 

flowchart TD
  A[Create & Name Folder] --> B[Create & Name Assembly Item];
  B --> C[Set Qty Per Count];
  C --> D["Add Child Item (Material, Part or Labor) to Assembly Item"];
  D -- Optional --> E[Use Helpful Name Formula];
  D --> F;
  E --> F[Search & Select SKU Inventory Item From Selected Item Dropdown];
  F --> G[Confirm Parent/Child Assembly Structure];
  G -- Optional --> H[Drag & Drop Assembly Into Template For Later Use];

docs.title: Materials VS Parts
docs.text:
It is important to understand that certain PlanSwift Reports will separate Part and Material data. This can ultimately affect how quotes are generated via PlanSwift Reports.

Very Important

This is the proper way to structure PlanSwift Parent/Child Items so that data is properly displayed on PlanSwift Reports. For more details about individual items please see ▸ Field Definitions PlanSwift ScreenshotText Tree

Folder └─ Segment (For measuring linear feet)  |     └─ Assembly (Container of items) Ex. door, trim, closet, etc.  |           ├─ Material (Inventory items with SKU & Cost data)  |           ├─ Part (Same as Material items)  |           ├─ Labor (Inhouse manufacturing labor)  |           ├─ Subcontract (Install labor)  |           └─ Other (Option items) └─ Count (For counting qty)      └─ Assembly (Container of items) Ex. door, trim, closet, etc.            ├─ Material (Inventory items with SKU & Cost data)            ├─ Part (Same as Material items)            ├─ Labor (Inhouse manufacturing labor)            ├─ Subcontract (Install labor)            └─ Other (Option items)

docs.title: Use-case
docs.text: You need to include an external item in an Assembly.

docs.title: Add External Items To PlanSwift List Database
Add "Other" (Option) Items To Takeoff Assembly Item
Display Options Data With PlanSwift Reports
How-to: Generate Bulk Tools with Assembly Builder
Scenario
docs.text: Inventory prices updated → you need 800+ assemblies refreshed.

docs.title: 1 Update inventory source
docs.text: Settings ▸ Inventory file → browse new Excel/CSV.

docs.title: 2 Build batch
docs.text:
Batch Group: STD_HOUSE_PACKAGE SKUs linked: 823 Out-of-date assemblies: 17

Click Generate Script.

docs.title: 3 Run script in PlanSwift
docs.text:
Tools ▸ Execute Script → pick generated .psscript.

PlanSwift logs each insert to Output window.

docs.title: 4 Verify
docs.text: Run Cut List → spot-check high-impact SKUs.

docs.title: How-to: Update Inventory Costs
docs.text:
1. Open inventory_costs.xlsx.
  2. Edit Cost_Each; keep SKU unchanged.
  3. Save.

docs.title: Refresh assemblies
docs.text:
Re-run Assembly Builder Build Batch. Only assemblies with changed SKUs regenerate (hash diff).

Danger

Do not rename SKUs in the sheet—assemblies reference SKU as key.

docs.title: Bump plugin version?
docs.text: If > 25 % of SKUs change, create new plugin release (e.g. 2.1.0) and post on portal.

docs.title: How-to: Run Custom Millwork Reports
docs.text: Report Purpose Bid Summary Client-facing quote with margin Cut List Shop cutting dimensions Segment Cost Cost breakdown by Segment

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Finish measurements.
  2. Reports ▸ Custom → choose report.
  3. In Parameters: set Segment or Job filter.
  4. Click Preview → Export (PDF, XLS).

Note

Reports read [Takeoff] quantities—ensure take-offs updated.

docs.title: Assembly Builder CLI
docs.text: ```bash assembly_builder.exe build ^ --inventory C:\data\inventory_costs.xlsx ^ --group STD_HOUSE_PACKAGE ^ --out C:\export\assemblies.psscript ^ --skip-unchanged Flag Default Description --inventory inventory_costs.xlsx Source price sheet --group ALL Batch group --out assemblies.psscript Output path --skip-unchanged false Hash diff optimization

docs.title: Database Schema
docs.text:
(Excerpt – open the .mdb in Access for full view)

``` sql CREATE TABLE Inventory ( SKU TEXT PRIMARY KEY, Description TEXT, Cost_Each CURRENCY, UOM TEXT, Updated DATETIME );

CREATE TABLE AssemblyDefs ( AssemblyID AUTOINCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, Name TEXT, ParentSKU TEXT, QtyFormula TEXT );

Note

Assembly Builder queries via pyodbc; DSN-less connection string: Driver={Microsoft Access Driver (.mdb, .accdb)}; DBQ=C:\Users\\Documents\PlanSwift Data\Lists\MillworkInventory.mdb;

docs.title: Pascal Script Snippets
docs.text:
```pascal procedure Main; var itm: IItem; begin itm := ItemManager.NewItem('Material'); itm.Name := '1x4 Casing'; itm.SetProperty('SKU', 'C1X4-PRM'); itm.SetProperty('Cost Each', 1.15); end;

Main;

Function | Purpose NewItem(Type) | Creates item of given millwork type NavigateToLinkedPage() | Opens detail page (UI)

docs.title: Field Reference · Count
docs.text:
Used for Count items that tally discrete objects (hinges, pulls).

Field Type Description SKU Text links Inventory Count Number integer Location Text optional

docs.title: Field Reference · Job
docs.text: Field Type Required Description Job # Text ✓ Internal project code Client Text ✓ End-customer name Date Date ✓ Project start Estimator Text User login; auto

docs.title: Field Reference · Labor
docs.text: Field Purpose Task e.g. Install Door Crew Rate $/hour from LaborRates table Hours Decimal

docs.title: Field Reference · Material
docs.text: Field Purpose SKU Inventory lookup Cost Each Auto from DB or override Qty Source [Takeoff] or fixed number Waste % Extra material allowance

docs.title: Field Reference · Part
docs.text:
Same as Material plus:

Field Purpose Parent Assembly GUID of assembly item Hardware Set Group ID for doors

docs.title: Field Reference · Subcontract
docs.text: Field Purpose Vendor External shop Quoted Cost Lump sum Deliver Date ETA
